title: Sudan Military Clashes: Why It Matters and Who Is Battling for Control
description: The strategically important country in northeastern Africa has been consumed by turmoil after overthrowing a dictator in 2019, with plans for a civilian-led democracy now in shambles.

title: What to Know About General Hamdan, Leader of Sudan’s Rapid Support Forces
description: A former camel trader who led a militia accused of genocidal violence in Darfur, Lt. Gen. Mohamed Hamdan, widely known as Hemeti, leads the Rapid Support Forces paramilitary unit.

title: Who Is Gen. Abdel Fattah al-Burhan of Sudan?
description: Little known before 2019, he rose to power in the aftermath of the military-led coup that ousted Omar Hassan al-Bashir, the longtime leader who was deposed after popular uprisings.

title: Boy’s Suicide in Poland Spurs Backlash Against State Media Tactics
description: A public radio station in the city of Szczecin is under fire for helping to identify a 15-year-old sex abuse victim, the son of a local opposition politician, who later killed himself.

title: Boy’s Suicide in Poland Spurs Backlash Against State Media Tactics
description: A public radio station in the city of Szczecin is under fire for helping to identify a 15-year-old sex abuse victim, the son of a local opposition politician, who later killed himself.

title: What Leaked Pentagon Documents Say About the Russia-Ukraine War
description: Some in Ukraine even welcomed the disclosures as confirming what they have been saying for months — that its forces desperately need more weapons and munitions.

title: Live Updates: Gunfire and Blasts Rock Sudan’s Capital
description: Weeks of mounting tensions between rival military leaders have turned violent, with reports of battles at the airport, the presidential palace and many other parts of Khartoum.

title: Reconsidering Tax Day
description: Make it a time of personal inventory, of looking back and taking account.

title: Rescuers Search Rubble in Eastern Ukraine as Death Toll From Russian Strike Climbs to Nine
description: Russia sent a barrage of missiles into residential areas of the city of Sloviansk on Friday, according to Ukrainian officials.

title: We Want to Hear From Canada Letter Readers
description: An overview of what the newsletter is and isn’t and what we try to achieve each week.

title: At Christianity’s Holiest Site, Rival Monks Struggle to Turn Other Cheek
description: At the Church of the Holy Sepulcher in Jerusalem, on the site where Jesus is believed to have been crucified and resurrected, a centuries-long real estate spat tends to flare up at Orthodox Easter.

title: ‘The Tale of Genji’ Is More Than 1,000 Years Old. What Explains Its Lasting Appeal?
description: The book is often described as the world’s first novel and a touchstone of Japanese literature. But some of its themes, including its take on gender and power, have echoed over centuries.

title: Why China’s Leader Hasn’t Called the President of Ukraine
description: China had been Ukraine’s top trade partner, importing barley, corn and arms. Now, Russia’s war raises the question: Is there still a relationship?

title: How African Restaurant Baobab Fare Found Success in Detroit
description: Hamissi Mamba, a refugee from Burundi, knew little of American culture when he arrived eight years ago and learned English watching the “Peppa Pig” cartoon. But he opened his dream restaurant, and the accolades have rolled in.

title: A Fresh Map of Mars, From a Spacecraft Called Hope
description: Scientists assembled 3,000 images from an Emirati orbiter to create the prettiest atlas yet of the red planet.

title: Fighting Erupts in Sudan’s Capital
description: Residents reported clashes between the army and a powerful paramilitary group across the city, after weeks of mounting tensions between military leaders.

title: Ishay Ribo, Religious Pop Star, Is Winning Over Secular Israel
description: The songs of Ishay Ribo, who was raised in a settlement on the West Bank, are a staple of Israeli radio. He is part of a wave of singers from religious backgrounds who are also gaining a wider audience.

title: Japan’s Prime Minister Safely Evacuated After Blast
description: Prime Minister Fumio Kishida was about to give a speech in the western Japanese city of Wakayama when a loud explosion was heard.

title: Airman Charged in Leak of Classified Documents
description: Jack Teixeira, 21, was granted a top-secret security clearance in 2021, which was required for his job, the Justice Department complaint said.

title: Brazil’s Lula Meets Xi in China as They Seek Path to Peace in Ukraine
description: Brazil has been reluctant about choosing sides in the war, as its new president, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, seeks to rebuild the country’s ties with Beijing.
